website_summaries.verdict: A popular electrically powered irrigator with a variety of desirable features. Tops our list when it comes to power and performance.
pros: Off the charts in terms of effectiveness
Cleans below the gum line thanks to the powerful yet gentle water jet
Ten water pressure settings and seven flosser tips
cons: Requires an electrical socket to operate, but the UK-friendly power cord has a two-pin plug

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and a travel one as have been having problems with my gums. If you are torn between the two I would definitely recommend getting the full size version. The two are not really comparable. Water tank in full size only needs filling once and you can change the pressure from 1 to 10. 5 is enough for me at the moment. As you can see it is actually quite compact and doesn’t take up much room on the sink. The portable one is massive and needed filling up 4 times in order to do all of my teeth. My teeth and gums feel super clean so will see what the hygienist says at my appointment today!
customer_reviews.author: lullibell

customer_reviews.title: A Disappointment...
customer_reviews.text: It all started pretty well. Suddenly after a bit more than 2 month it stopped working. Calling the number I found in previous comments did not work. Opening a complaint to their customer care ended with no response. Do these guys really exist??
customer_reviews.author: Guy T

customer_reviews.title: very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: The previous make i had lasted about 14 months before packing in so i read many reviews before purchasing this one This waterpik is highly rated by many product reviews and i'll also give it the thumbs up. It is certainly quieter than the previous make i used and comes with a variety of piks to cover most teeth/gum situations. Overall,very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Hard to please.

customer_reviews.title: Low reliability
customer_reviews.text: The device died suddenly after four months Calculated usage time: About 10 hours I'm not the only one who has had such a case, The network is full of articles on similar cases. It's a pity I did not read before buying and I believed recommendations on the net
customer_reviews.author: ELI MENDA

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this produce
customer_reviews.text: I was quiet happy at first with the produce but it juste stopped working after 4 month I bought it in October for a Christmas present for my partner. Started to use it at the end of December and now in May it just stopped working, this problem happen to quiet a few people. NOT A GOOD BUY
customer_reviews.author: dominique charles

customer_reviews.title: No longer works after less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Either very unlucky or this is not fit for purpose. WIthin 3 months the handle was faulty, could not connect the “piks”. Waterpik customer support sent a replacement hose/handle set. Unfortunately the replacement was faulty on arrival, the hose was torn so water went everywhere. Waterpik sent another hose/handle replacement. All seemed fine until the unit decided to stop working altogether. So that’s less than 6 months in, 2 replacement parts and now it no longer works. When it worked, it was great. But the quality in our experience is atrocious.
customer_reviews.author: interbear

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a year!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I discovered this product earlier!! It’s amazing in keeping my teeth clean. I dislike manual flossing and this seems to be the perfect solution. Can’t wait for my next dental visit for my dentist to assess the condition of my teeth and gums. Would highly recommend if you are thinking about it. The size is perfect too for my family of 3. My 6yo uses it and loves it too. Glad it fitted nicely in the corner of our sink. Update 3 Sep 2019. Our Waterpik stopped working exactly one year on. I am still trying to get in touch with their customer support which does not seem that helpful at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: Lacks the power I would like.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first water flosser I have tried so can't compare to others. I am using it as PART of my dental hygiene routine. The use of interdental brushes still required. Trying it to flush mouthwash over / round implants. Not as powerful as a 'Gingejet' I had from my dentist years ago (unfortunately no longer available).
customer_reviews.author: Wendy F

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 weeks. There does not seem ...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 2 weeks. There does not seem to be any procedure for returning the item after the one month returns window.
customer_reviews.author: Simon L.

customer_reviews.title: Great item, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant item! I use this instead of floss, and my hygienist is happy! Even after a thorough brushing, this item excavates food from the hardest to reach places. Would wholeheartedly recommend this product. (For the record, I have received no incentive to write this review).
customer_reviews.author: Navy Rich

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy - water spurts everywhere and it’s also coming apart after 6 minths
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this model - buy one that you can charge up, fill with water and use in the shower. Because Water spurts everywhere. Also it is not very robust -after 6 months of me using it just once a week it is coming apart
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product. I am finding that the motor cuts out if I try to turn the machine up to a pressure above 8. Not at all happy it's turned out to be a white elephant. This item was not cheap and is not fit for purpose. A waste of money in my opinion and it's back in it's box. Dental floss and brushes are back on my shopping list.
customer_reviews.author: LadyJo

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing, when I first bought this I found it tricky to use , spraying water everywhere ! It just takes a little while to get the knack of it. My son had braces and he uses the orthodontic attachment to blast any food residue from them , and my other children could never get the hang of ordinary floss. This does a much better job than floss cleaning perfectly between the teeth and toughens up your gums as well all in a fraction of the time normal flossing takes. I would never be without one now I’ve had it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: This is a great flosser, lots of tips, good water tank capacity and a very wide pressure range. Pity it broke after 7 months of (shamefully) infrequent use. I turned it on one day and it just spluttered a few times, the lights started blinking, fizzled out and it never turned on a again. Maybe you'll have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money - cheap make - useless motor
customer_reviews.text: Arrived a couple of days ago. Plugged it in today and used it for barely 60 seconds. Thought pressure was too low n turned it up to max.... puff...it shudders n dies. Cheap trash made in China ! I dont want a replacement...just a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: MSM Pillai

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Waterpik for many years and I love them never need any work when i go and see the dentist. I find fossing difficult as my teeth are very close together but the Waterpik works wonders taking just 90 seconds twice aday. This model is the best one yet good tank volume even on level/power 10 on/off switch on handle giving more control and handy little storage holes for upto 2 extra colour coded heads.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lee Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Recommed by my hygienist
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended when I went for my last check up. I normally used floss or fit this great and easy to use. It has to been connect to a mains shaver point, but its not to large ( now higher than electric tooth brush ), so does not take up much room in the bathroom. Water tank last enough time to do the whole mouth. If you fill water tank & leave it the water tends to condense on the lid, so when you open it again the water runs down the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas C Bruce

customer_reviews.title: GOOD WATER FLOSSER
customer_reviews.text: It definitely works! It takes quite a bit of getting used to and practice on how best to floss...need to try to hold your lip over the attachment as the water will go everywhere if you dont. It took me 4 or 5 times before I can do it with no mess! My only disappointment is that you have to keep it plugged into the "shaver" socket to use it - I thought it was chargeable, so if you dont have a shaver socket near your bathroom sink then it really is no use to you, other than that it is a great tool and sure your dentist will be pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Lighty

customer_reviews.title: Use it in the shower
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work ok, but using over the sink results in a lot of water going on the floor, so I use it in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Pig

customer_reviews.title: Potential depowered
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item after recommendation from my dentist as i was not flossing properly or throughly enough which was cause me to have gum issues. Read some earlier reviews about the motor cutting out but as this was recommended by my dentist i went ahead and purchaed it. This was great for the first 2 month (lordy it really cleans btw the teeth and almost makes you addicted to water flossing) but then engine started cutting out when turned to dial 6 asnd above. Now it cuts out on lowest dial and is now hit and miss. Would purchase again if motor issue can be resolved. How do i get my refund?
customer_reviews.author: Black Wolf - hint of Grey

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on the recommendation of my hygienist and she wasn't wrong. This is far quicker and more effective than flossing, without the damage you can sometimes inadvertently do to your gums. The first couple of times I used it, was very weird and my aim was terrible, but it's only water and with practice you get better. Dont use really cold water, cool/slightly warm is far more comfortable as is working your way up to a higher pressure. Pros: Brilliant clean, takes about a minute or so and minimal effort Cons: 2 pin plug, needing to find a plug near a sink Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M

customer_reviews.title: Strange product
customer_reviews.text: Total rubbish - maybe I need some pointers but at the moment it sits on the side collecting dust. I have tried it a few times before giving up, but it is noisy and messy with all the water spraying into your mouth and pouring out of your mouth and trying not to drown or throw up.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Isaacs

customer_reviews.title: Easy Cleaning
customer_reviews.text: My hygienist recommend using a floss or cleaners that you push through your gaps as my gums were inflamed. I tried it but that found very difficult to do and maintain. Did not realise this product existed. Found it while searching as a related product. Anyway, long story short, got this and it works. You can see bits of food fall out you though you had got through brushing. My hygienist is pleased with the results and admits to having one herself. She still recommends I do all the other stuff too and I will try but if not, this is working to some level and is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dtrman

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought one sooner
customer_reviews.text: My teeth feel and look so clean. I don’t worry about bad breath or what my dentist or hygienist will say at my next visit. I have waterpiks before so I know how but I can imagine that new users will find it takes a little while to figure it out. My tip is to start with a lower pressure and then build up staying comfortable with how it feels. Most importantly, Bend over your basin and keep your mouth open a bit so the water dribbles out. (Not an attractive look but it works).
customer_reviews.author: Hew

customer_reviews.title: Makes a big difference to your gum health
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it is mains powered and has a 3 year guarantee. The battery versions I have tried have never last more than 3 months. If you have never tried water flossing, then I can tell you that it makes a big difference to the health of your gums compared to little brushes and floss. So if you want compliments from the hygienist and dentist, this is money well spent. In fact it's an investment as I think you save money in the long run by avoiding dental treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good product mouth feels fresh
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine and still can't believe what it washes out. Mouth feels really fresh after using. Dentist told me to still use tepe brushes but as they keep breaking feel I'm not getting the full benefit from them whereas this product does in my opinion. An added bonus is that it also cleans the rim on the plug hole and base of the tap when I use the last bit of water on the sink from a distance of course haha
customer_reviews.author: Wardle

customer_reviews.title: Effective, powerful and well built.
customer_reviews.text: As a first time user, I spent few weeks to get used to it (lots of mess in the beginning), but I highly recommend. It's faster than flossing and the results are incredible. I even made tests flossing first and using Waterpick in the sequence. Waterpick was able to remove residuals that were not removed by flossing alone. Need to be careful with limescale. Need to frequently clean it by using vinegar, as stated on the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: NELSON ESQUIVEL

customer_reviews.title: effective flosser, reasonably quiet, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a few days but it has all the makings of a very good water flosser. It is a replacement for an older Kitty Hydrofloss which was also effective but the compressor positively screamed, it was so so noisy. The Waterpik 660 is very much quieter and a good clean design with easy to use controls and a good variety of pik heads for various purposes. Be prepared to top up the reservoir during normal use though as it only holds about 600ml of water. This is not a problem though as the reservoir is so easy to remove, refill and replace. The timer is also a good idea. All in all a good sturdy, well designed unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bluey

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but bulky
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flosser which is powerfull enough to clean the teeth. Drawbacks: 1- It is bulky, you need to have a shelf next to the sink so you can use it which not the case in most of the UK bathrooms. 2- You need to have a socket and very close to the sink as the plug cable is short. 3- also the tube between the handle and the flosser tank is not felxible and you might pull the flosser accidentally I had to order a different battery powered flosser as I cannot use this in my new flat. 4- It is also bulky to put it in your suitcase when you travel
customer_reviews.author: Sulaiman

customer_reviews.title: Much better than precious model in use
customer_reviews.text: Much better than precious model in use. Great improvement in lower plaque levels found by my hygienist. If you suffer from gum disease then highly recommended. You would be surprised at how much debris is removed even after brushing and mouthwash. Ideal for those who find it difficult to floss.
customer_reviews.author: LYN2GO

customer_reviews.title: Dead after a week of usage.
customer_reviews.text: Worked nice for a week and then it was dead. Worst buy of the year. I am returning and requesting a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: YK

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended to me by dentist as better more efficient alternative to flossing (not sure if he has shares in Waterpik or summat) . I dutifully purchased but it packed up after about 2 months. Haven't yet mustered the motivation to return the item then saw all these reviews saying the same thing that it died after few months use. something fundamentally wrong with the product in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: PAUL LLOYD

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit dubious about a water pik generally but my dentist recommended it to help with the difficult areas between crowns. I did a lot of research and chose this model based on value for money after reading other reviews. Connected to shaver point easily and up and running immediately. I'm really pleased with it! Yes, along with all the other water piks you can get a bit wet, but obviously not a problem straight after a shower and helpful if you have a deep sink to lean into. Very powerful and could be uncomfortable on sensitive teeth but using lukewarm water helps a lot. Bottom line - my dentist says its my new best friend!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!
customer_reviews.text: Yep, definitely life changing. No more spending hours trying to get to the awkward places. This is quick, works well and am so glad that I bought it. It is a little noisy when you switch on but as you'll only be using for such a short time that's no issue. Its a little louder than my electric toothbrush but as I say that's not an issue. I actually look forward to using this!! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Level-up your Flossing
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using the Waterpik for a while now and I have to say it’s great, just great. It gets to the hard to reach areas with ease as all you need to do is aim this little water jet. It definitely beats flossing manually which I almost never did before getting this. It’s very compact in its design, it can fit on my minuscule sink while I floss. I haven’t used anything but the standard head for it but it comes with a large variety of heads for different tasks. If you value your dental health and want to level up from manual flossing then I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: F. James

customer_reviews.title: Small, powerful and it works
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful, good selection of heads included, the capacity is a little on the small side, would like maybe a bigger one but overall great product. Would be nice to be able to color code the heads so we dont mix them up. I like that it is very small and very straightforward to operate. It does splash a little so you need to get used to opere the buttons and not take it out of your mouth before shutting off otherwise you ll get water everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: vlad c.

customer_reviews.title: Super Waterpik
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic. It is really great to use especially if you have a bridge. It comes with all different brush heads to use. It really makes your mouth fresh and flosses so much better than the string floss. I love it and I don't know why our dentists do not tell us about these things. Worth every penny. I bought the one where you just add mouthwash with warm water.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Using a water flosser takes a bit of getting used to, it's really easy to accidentally spray the room or your face - best not to try and use after a drink or two :) Once you get the hang of it things are better - I'm pretty sure using this regularly has improved my gum health, I'll be interested to see what my dentist says at the next checkup. I would have liked the on/off switch on the wand to be a bit more "grippy" maybe with a more pronounce tab on it, other than that it's good.
customer_reviews.author: CGW

customer_reviews.title: every-day necessity
customer_reviews.text: This water flosser is amazing. I was worried it would take up too much bathroom space but it fits neatly next to the sink. I couldn't live without it. In the past I struggled flossing my teeth with string - this waterpik is so pleasant and easy to use. It really is an every-day necessity for healthy gum maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Droth

customer_reviews.title: Does not support shaver socket and refunding item takes so much time. Bad seller
customer_reviews.text: I used wireless waterpik qhi h is great, thought to buy this wired one looks good and powerful and no need to recharge over and over again. It came but was unable to see it in action due to its not working in my bathroom power socket which is works fine for my electric toothbrush. Don't know but power does not support. So have to return. Seller is very slow in refuninh 3 days and email received it's not reached us back and in transit also they say once it's reached it will take 5 to 7 days to refund ahow in my account. Would not recommend to buy stuff feom this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Peeru

customer_reviews.title: Jet wash for the teeth enjoy
customer_reviews.text: If you have not used one you will not go wrong with this purchase. I have never had one before, I use the usual electric tooth brush and floss sticks but wow !! Yes I probably need to go to dentist to fill the gaps and but wow give this a blast and you can’t believe what has been sat in the teeth even after all that brushing and flossing !! Top tip use warm water and a splash of mouthwash and enjoy those sparkling clean teeth !! Powerful jet wash for the teeth !! Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Aitken

customer_reviews.title: Waterpik WP-660UK
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this. It's excellent at removing debris of meals in your mouth that you thought were gone. Time will tell if plaque is effectively removed, it certainly removes anything else. I advise filling the container with warm water as cold is too much of a shock to your mouth and teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: Great results - but noisy!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Waterpik Flosser after my dentist told me I had an 11cm infected dental pocket. After using the flosser for less than 4 months, my dentist confirmed the pocket had shrunk to 8cm and there was no longer any infection present. Introducing the Waterpik was the only change I had made to my dental regime, so can only attribute the improvement to the flosser. I have only given it 4* as it is probably the noisiest piece of kit (relative to its size) that I have ever owned. It's motor sounds like a mini pneumatic drill!! For me, the great results outweigh the noise issue.
customer_reviews.author: J W.

customer_reviews.title: By bye plaque ...
customer_reviews.text: Bye bye plaque and gingivitis hello healthy teeth and gums. Much nicer than flossing with string etc. Good price and great service. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Stuckey

customer_reviews.title: A gimmick?
customer_reviews.text: This is no substitute for using floss tape or sticks. It doesn’t get between your teeth and it’s messy with water everywhere if used on full blast. The water runs back down the hand piece cord. Getting the probe to run along the back of your teeth and gums isn’t straightforward and that's where flossing is most needed. It takes me two or three reservoirs of water to do upper and lower gums/teeth....and then I still need to use floss. So what’s the point of it? Reckon I’ll just be reverting to my electric toothbrush with traditional flossing flossing.
customer_reviews.author: Oxonlad

customer_reviews.title: Best product I've found - use lukewarm water if your teeth are sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I'd hate to be without this. I am now on my third Waterpik, but only because I found the rechargeable version did not hold charge well (it's worth considering whether you have easy access to UK plug sockets nearby). This model is brilliant, and I recommend it to any poor soul who will listen, particularly those who have had recent dental work, eg. those with crowns and/or braces. I know there are air versions of other brands, but I like the fact you can use room temperature water (for sensitivity) and your usual mouth wash.
customer_reviews.author: Pootle

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Really powerful little machine. It's good that there's a dial to adjust the pressure, as I still can't cope with it on full blast. I don't want to moan about so many buttons (2, and the dial), but it is a bit confusing to remember what order they work in. Still, I understand that it is necessary, because of the high pressure. This is the most powerful oral irrigator I have ever used, so it was worth the money. It gets right into the gum pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Clean teeth
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was worried about going to the hygienist because of covid risk. I have used it for a fortnight twice a day on half power as I find full power too strong It has really cleaned my teeth up. I use it after an electric toothbrush and it gets every last bit of food out from between teeth which has been missed. It is quite expensive but so is going to the hygienist expensive. If it lasts a year I will be quids in.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. L.

customer_reviews.title: Useless gimmick; had to go back to regular floss & dental harps
customer_reviews.text: It's like a mini pressure washer. Alright for cleaning the plug hole in my sink and stuff like that. Not sure how I feel about it as a tooth cleaning tool. I've largely gone back to dental floss / dental harps so far. Bit concerned about the power required to get stuff out, and the likelihood of it digging micro-holes into your cheeks and gums instead of cleaning around them. It's very awkward to use, initially. But maybe I'll get more used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Odd feeling but fantastically effective
customer_reviews.text: My wife has always taken care of her teeth. She is in her 40's and has one filling and no extractions. However, her gun scores were always 1's and 2's. I bought her this kit and 4 weeks later at her hygenist check-up she was 0 all round. I find the pulseing a bit disconcerting, but the effect is amazing (I haven't achieved 0's, but I have implants so a bit of a bigger challenge I guess) Couldn't recommend it more highly.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Gater

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product! Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this product as I have a fixed bridge. I’ve used other water flossers before and they hurt me due to the pressure. This product has just saved my mouth... continual water flow, pressure settings so I can have it low and build up. If you are looking for a gentle water flosser this is the one. The ONLY thing is I would say it’s a little messy when you first use it... put your head over the sink or else your mirror will need drying... price worth paying if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: Roxsan Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Lots of these appear to stop working
customer_reviews.text: This was great for about 2 weeks. It was encouraging me to floss and doing a good job. Then it stopped working. I started using it after the period by which it could be sent back so now it appears I am stuck with it. I have not contacted support but reviews elsewhere suggest this is non-existent so not hopeful. Look at all the other reviews where it says it stopped working. Wish I'd focussed on them!
customer_reviews.author: Trip Dude

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a water flosser for years. I used the Phillips. It was getting old in the tooth (joke) so got this. It does what it says, comes with quite a few heads and I am amazed as to how much stuff comes out from my teeth after use. I should add that prior to using this each morning and evening I floss and use tape brushes but this flosser still finds debris. Hint - so as not to have a cold shock to your gums I recommend filling the reservoir up with warm water.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Druce

customer_reviews.title: Must have - in addition to your regular oral hygiene
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. If you haven’t used something like this yet, I urge you to try it. If you use it after you brush your teeth, chances are you will be amazed (or disgusted) by how much stuff has been stuck between your teeth! I don’t even want to start thinking about how the bacteria has been stuck in my mouth- even though I brush religiously! I can only recommend this, seriously. Has different levels of water pressure and different heads you can use
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: Very good for your teeth and gums
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an earlier Waterpik model which just gave out after around 5 years. It’s a great improvement. The handle sits more neatly inside the holster and the water container is a better shape. But essentially it does the same great job of getting food debris out of your mouth with ease. Far better than flossing or even the best electric brush. It’s expensive but over longer term will pay for itself in reduced dental bills
customer_reviews.author: Jenny rogers

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for price reductions
customer_reviews.text: Received this product last week and discovered today it has been reduced by £10. A little disappointed I missed out on the offer. The product so far seems to live up to expectations. I recommended it to a few people who have purchased at the cheaper price!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Doz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product, I read the positive reviews and it is that good. I used to avoid flossing knowing it was important but this makes it a pleasure. I noticed the improvement immediately, teeth appear cleaner. As others have mentioned it is quite powerful, a setting of 7-8 is more than enough to thoroughly clear all debris between teeth and around the gum line. It also comes with a full set of interchange jets and brushes. I now use it everyday and wouldn’t be without it.
customer_reviews.author: Glassman

customer_reviews.title: Always Floss
customer_reviews.text: very good at dislodging food trapped in teeth from eating throughout the day. due to the stiffnes of the water hose it can be a little awkward to move around the different angles of the mouth. The device plugs into a wallshaving plug socket and isn't too loud, but not super silent. if you care about your teeth and gum health, this is a wise purchase you won't regret.
customer_reviews.author: Cloudy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Totally a waste of money! Poorly made and all it did was squirt water.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Really useful bit of kit!
customer_reviews.text: I find this really easy to use, and not painful at all, even on the strongest setting. Because it’s far easier and more comfortable to use than flossing with tape, I use it regularly - at least two or three times a week. My tip would be to use lukewarm water though, as cold can make your teeth jump! I waited to write this review until after six months of use, and a visit to my very stern dental hygienist. She very reluctantly admitted that my oral health was excellent, and the small areas of gum disease had disappeared. I’m delighted! Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: I cannot rate as can't use
customer_reviews.text: none of the eu adaptors I have work with the 2 prong plug on my new waterpik..... I have phoned and they said a shaver adaptor would work...... I have just tried it and it won't...... can waterpik supply me with one that will work.
customer_reviews.author: daisy

customer_reviews.title: WATERPIK
customer_reviews.text: iTS FINE. I have have different water piks before and this one is all right but I find it a bit finicky on the hand set. The on and off switch on the hand set is a bit stiff. Overall it does what you want and washes out your teeth in between the gaps.
customer_reviews.author: Saphira

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to work well once I managed to get it going then it stoped and wouldn’t turn on waited while it came in then stoped this was on first day so returned iv giving up trying to find one that dose what they say
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for the suggestion, Mr Hygienist!
customer_reviews.text: Anything to do with the dentist is scary. My Hygienist suggested this model for a really good gum cleaning. It has taken a bit of getting used to (water spraying everywhere if I didn't concentrate), but is so so useful for a good solid washing away of food debris. Using warm water rather than cold was a really good tip.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome
customer_reviews.text: I wish we had it sooner, my teeth feel a lot cleaner. Since using this, flossing has become so much more pleasant. I was doubtful if this can get between nook and crannies, but it does! I didn't have to use the dental string one.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. A. Vu

customer_reviews.title: Happy cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I love it, I had problems flossing with silk before, now I am happy using the Waterpik - I had other models in the past, but I like this one best. It is a large item for a normal hand wash basin, but if you really need the help you can always find a space for it. Firts time I used a too high speed for my sensitive soft gums, so make sure you have the right level before you hurt your gums. It does an excellent job cleaning, I am happily using it
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: Gums feel so much better!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item before Christmas when it was on sale - best purchase ever! My gums feel great and have stopped bleeding so much! Event my dentist was impressed (need to work on my top gums a bit more). Cleans great also and gets the food out between my teeth. All the family use it (comes with extra nozzles). It's a bit loud, but I don't really care! Works a treat!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs T

customer_reviews.title: A powerful flosser
customer_reviews.text: It takes a bit of time to get used to angling the flossing head correctly, and you should definitely set it at its lowest power and work upwards, but it seems to do the job intended. At mid range power it blasts water out, so be careful if you've got sensitive gums. Nicely designed and reassuringly sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I hate flossing but this allows me to do it with ease. Water went everywhere the first few times of use, trick is to keep head over the basin and not look at what you are doing in the mirror. Gets rid of the bad taste I get near my crown.
customer_reviews.author: Ann-Marie Clayton

customer_reviews.title: A Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a recommendation and I’m so pleased I did, especially now as I can’t visit the dentist due to the pandemic. It’s true, it does take a little getting used to, it’s so easy at first to get water everywhere. My husband decided he’d try it too as he has a bridge, he was amazed at how much trapped debris it removed. It comes with several different heads for different use. We’re so pleased with it we’re thinking of buying a battery water pick for use on holidays.
customer_reviews.author: MBS

customer_reviews.title: Effective at plaque removal
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after advice from my hygienist, takes a bit of getting used to , but has certainly made a difference by removing far more plaque than just brushing using a oscillating electric toothbrush, it’s a bit messy to use but if it produces the required results , well worth the slight bother
customer_reviews.author: Yeovil Rog

customer_reviews.title: Very effective!
customer_reviews.text: Straightforward to set up and use. I am impressed by how effective it is and immediately noticed how clean my teeth felt. I have yet to see how effective it has been with plaque until I next see the hygienist. However, as Covid has delayed routine dental treatment this may prove a vital purchase!
customer_reviews.author: N M.

customer_reviews.title: Scarily Efficient!
customer_reviews.text: Can't reccomend this enough, it's so supprising to see how much debris this wiil remove even after brushing. You do need to have a bit of a nack on the way it's used as it can be a bit messy with water going every way but once you've mastered it, like everything in life, it's easy!
customer_reviews.author: Stevieboy

customer_reviews.title: Waterpik
customer_reviews.text: Cleaning my teeth naturally! A machine that is easy to use not too big in the bathroom but it is not as powerful as the previous one I had even on 9.5
customer_reviews.author: Philip Greig Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for peridontal pocket trapped food blasting
customer_reviews.text: Was a recommendation. For my peridontal pockets around my crown. Works well and removes all the trapped food to prevent the inflamation of my gum. Just wish I had a shaver socket in my bathroom but I didn't want to risk a battery version in case less powerful. Glad I chose this one. Works a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Way of Flossing
customer_reviews.text: There was nothing to dislike about it. It is a fantastic piece of kit. They should do a small one to take on holiday because you really can tell if you do not use it. It is easy to use, value for money and we feel it was the best product. Wish we would have purchased one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: derbyshire girls

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Gum Cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Purchased yesterday on next day delivery. I have gum problems; dentist recommendation. Just used it for the first time and my teeth around gum area feel really clean. Was noticing that although I use interdentals, teeth didn't feel clean around the gum area. I believe this is going be a great asset. Bit messy, but was my first use, and quite frankly not as messy as I thought it would be first time.
customer_reviews.author: Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Great flosser
customer_reviews.text: I previously tried a cordless one but there is no comparison with the power and the container capacity for water. I was reluctant to have a plug one, but did not regret a bit to have purchased such great item. Easy to use and the water container is perfect for a single use without the need to refill again.
customer_reviews.author: Piera

customer_reviews.title: Great bit of kit (especially if you have a socket)
customer_reviews.text: Works brilliantly, pressure is very adjustable (I keep it at about 1/2 power), lots of heads with it. I'd no socket or shaver light with socket to plug into in the bathroom so had to use it in the kitchen. That was fine but a bit of a pain. Ended up having a socket installed in a bathroom cabinet so that I dont have to unplug it. Very happy now. Have an electrician install it through as needs specialist consideration: electricity with water can kill!
customer_reviews.author: Dermot Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Best one so far - very happy
customer_reviews.text: I've owned probably 5 of these things over the years. As already said, after about two years they tend to break down, which is what happened with my previous one. I was skeptical that the 'new' model was any better than other. But it is. The water coming out feels a little 'thicker' - meaning it's not like a needle of water coming out (something I've experienced previously). It feels to me like my teeth and gums get a better cleaning. Plus, a minor but good thing, the design is well done. I have the white model. In short, if you already have one, and are skeptical, I'd rate this as the best one I've had.
customer_reviews.author: crypticon

customer_reviews.title: Great flosser.
customer_reviews.text: I have problems with flossing my teeth and remembered a client in Germany recommending a WaterPik back in the 80’s. I tried it out and it really works well. Clean as a whistle. After some months it didn’t work but the suppliers sent a new one. Happy again. Great product great support.
customer_reviews.author: Stringer Hub

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong, long after I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Not my first WaterPik. These things make a HUGE difference to the health of my gums... and quick, easy to use. My dentist suggested adding a tablespoon of Listerine... that brand, specifically, to the water used. Warm water is fine, and is easier on sensitive teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Sheepdog

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the travel one I bought at half the price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it was on the Deal of the Day at £49.99 and I thought it would be an upgrade from the one I was using which I bought for £24.99 about 6 months ago. How wrong I was. The pressure doesn't seem to be enough to clean properly unless you crank it up to 10. After a few uses I tried flossing with and then straight away used my old one which dislodged some food matter that the Waterpik had left behind. I have returned it and received a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Bee

customer_reviews.title: More better👍
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my waterpik. It has well written instructions. It comes with a half dozen pics for different functions and has 10 pressure settings. A pleasure to use. I sent back the Nicefeel flosser as it was terrible. I’m trying to figure out how it got such high ratings. Spend a few bob more and get the waterpik wp 660!
customer_reviews.author: boccigallupo

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine - use it every day with couple of teaspoons of hydrogen peroxide in the water chamber (3% food grade). As Dr Levy told me, gums bleed initially and then eventually they stop bleeding and you develop awesome gums and teeth!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nash

customer_reviews.title: Clean feeling, but quite noisy
customer_reviews.text: Great product, leaves my mouth feeling very fresh and clean afterwards. The tank needs refilling after every use, but thats not an issue. The only reason for not being 5 stars is that I live in shared accommodation and it is very noisy, but other than that it's a brilliant bit of kit, cable to plug in is also pretty long, which is ideal for high sockets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vital for gum disease treatment
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had insane problems with gums and been having to poke brushes and all sorts into pockets between gums and teeth- not any more! I fill the test with lukewarm water, turn on floss and my gums can cope with the highest pressure setting. I spend 1 min and 1 tankful on upper then same for lower jaw working my way around the gum line with nozzle pointed into the “pockets” or rather where they used to be. My teeth seem whiter, mouth feels fresher and hygienist and dentist are v impressed with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Fisher Al

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several Waterpiks and this is one of the best. It really gives the gaps between teeth a good blasting and although I never use floss (gets caught between teeth), and rarely use tee-pee brushes I am always complimented about my cleaning by dentists and hygienists. My only complaint is that the wand tends to leak and water drips along my arm if I'm not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant bit of kit.
customer_reviews.text: A brilliant bit of kit and works really well. Certainly solves the between the teeth issues and certainly makes our teeth feel clean especially if some mouth was is used. Our old model, different brand, was able to be attached to the wall with silicon which created space in a restricted area. This option is not available but footprint is not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: IanJ

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure if its really a good purchase. I managed to use it only once to try it on and thats all. My bathroom does not have a plug and there comes the problem. Its not easy to constantly get extension to use it or use it over the kitchen sink too.
customer_reviews.author: Dobrin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this, my whole mouth seems so much better and it's really helped clearing under the gums where my wisdom teeth are coming through. First one delivered did not work but I had a replacement in 2 days, could do with a longer cord as I'm having to use an extension lead would've been nice if it came with the accessories storage case
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: It’s very easy to use and cleans well, though I combine it with normal flossing and using interdental brushes. My mouth feels very clean after using it. I also like the massage feature, it feels really good for my gums
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Eva Koudela

customer_reviews.title: Water pick
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had this water pick long before now! I've always had good strong teeth but this product takes dental care to another level. Wow is all I can say. If you love your teeth and you want to keep them, then I will absolutely reccomend you buy this machine. It's worth every penny no questions asked. This is the best I've come across👍🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
customer_reviews.author: Oladapo king

customer_reviews.title: Stop working after 2.5 months
customer_reviews.text: Product is good and works fine but just 2.5 mths in..... it stop working. Can't power on. ----------------- Upgraded from 1 star to 4 star because Amazon is going to send a replacement, even though it's more than 60 days. Kudos to customer service. Hope this round the it will last. Keeping fingers crossed. ---------------- Upgraded to 5 stars. Replacement reached me in less than a week and that's half way around the way. As long as Amazon backs up the warranty. I will endorse this product. Most of the 5 stars comes from Amazon by the way,
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Warranty Backup.
customer_reviews.text: I had the Waterpik for just over 8 months before it failed. I contacted the company and filed a warranty claim. I must admit that they were very helpful and replaced the faulty unit very quickly. Excellent customer care, well done. Just for anyones interest the unit failed because the 240v to 12v DC converter had decided to stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Moorcraft

customer_reviews.title: Feels great teeth feel cleaner after first try.
customer_reviews.text: Use twice a day gums much better feels like a trip after a dentist. My teeth and gums feel super clean, pressure from 1 to 10 even the low setting are strong jet. Very happy with this water jet.
customer_reviews.author: Rid

customer_reviews.title: Fab
customer_reviews.text: This is so good, is a replacement for my existing one that after a couple of years had some mould in it, mown fault for leaving with water to stagnate when not in use Mouth feels so clean with this and my hygienist is impressed
customer_reviews.author: Tarbo

customer_reviews.title: fani
customer_reviews.text: The previous make i had lasted about 14 months before packing in so i read many reviews before purchasing this one This waterpik is highly rated by many product reviews and i'll also give it the thumbs up. It is certainly quieter than the previous make i used and comes with a variety of piks to cover most teeth/gum situations. Overall,very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Utterly rubbish...
customer_reviews.text: ...noisy as a hammer drill, very poor design, see in the picture that the water from the drain holes is "routed" towards the electric cord, and after just 40 days stopped working. Return and refund is all I need.
customer_reviews.author: catalinthe13th

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Great product everyone should use one, only 4 stars on easy to use as I would like cable longer , but I’m sure it’s fine for most bathroom, I use it in family bathroom as cable isn’t long enough in my on suite.
customer_reviews.author: linda m.

product_meta.title: Tartar, Plaque Remover for Teeth Cleaning Kit - Ultrasonic Tooth Cleaner - Dental Calculus Remover - Removes Calculus, Stain, Plaque, Tartar - Teeth Cleaning Tool #

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
